1.text: Wisdom hath builded her house; She hath hewn out her seven pillars:

2.text: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; She hath also furnished her table:

3.text: She hath sent forth her maidens; She crieth upon the highest places of the city:

4.text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: As for him that is void of understanding, she saith to him,

5.text: Come, eat ye of my bread, And drink of the wine which I have mingled.

6.text: Leave off, ye simple ones, and live; And walk in the way of understanding.

7.text: He that correcteth a scoffer getteth to himself reviling; And he that reproveth a wicked man getteth himself a blot.

8.text: Reprove not a scoffer, lest he hate thee: Reprove a wise man, and he will love thee.

9.text: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: Teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.

10.text: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom; And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

11.text: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, And the years of thy life shall be increased.

12.text: If thou art wise, thou art wise for thyself; And if thou scoffest, thou alone shalt bear it.

13.text: The foolish woman is clamorous; She is simple, and knoweth nothing.

14.text: And she sitteth at the door of her house, On a seat in the high places of the city,

15.text: To call to them that pass by, Who go right on their ways:

16.text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither; And as for him that is void of understanding, she saith to him,

17.text: Stolen waters are sweet, And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

18.text: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; That her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
